title: [IOTDB-5125] Change default port and stop the process when port is already in use
body:
## IOTDB-5125

### Port change
Changed the dn_schema_region_consensus_port from 50010 to 40030, because it conflicts with a port of hdfs
Related doc is: https://apache-iotdb.feishu.cn/docx/doxcnjzB2xd9sScIlkNYJUJA1zb
Wait until ip:port change is supported.

### Added check
Now the shell can detect whether the ports set are occupied, and print the processes occuping them.
Test pictures:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/87789683/207375964-742809f8-fe91-4e52-85e4-1ca76fedbb69.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/87789683/207376234-c1027c2c-c799-450e-bca1-66b3aa2679ac.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/87789683/207377929-4b070e29-39fa-4307-ae4b-364e15f992be.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/87789683/207378034-37cdd763-d6df-4a7e-b69e-6efa93515f3a.png)

### Perfected the shell
Added some hint for users to correctly run the shell. 
See details in "File changes" column.

title: [IOTDB-4005] Pipeline fragmentInstance to implement parallel execution
body:
In order to make full use of the single machine multi-core performance, and improve the CPU utilization and query performance, we further split the Fragment instance into multiple pipelines for processing.

CPU Fragment instance  pipeline 

Performance Test results:
Single data region situation(Single fragment instance for one query):
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34242296/211445814-f314e979-79ac-431a-8ca5-563e2bbc62dd.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34242296/211445841-b2fb4091-2a7c-4f7d-b2a6-6de27715eaf6.png)


Our weekly test, it's single sensor query, so there is no obvious performance improvement.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16079446/211437105-0ce37ec1-aae5-4743-a0da-4f324635cde7.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16079446/211437110-9c987812-0bed-4eba-81c5-3966421882ff.png)

title: [To rel/1.0][IOTDB-5183]Fix CI OOM
body:
**Description**
OutOfMemory unable to create new native thread

**Reason**
The sub threads in `CompactionTaskManager` are not closed. During the test, new sub compaction thread pool is constantly created and the number of sub-threads increases, which causes OOM.

**Solution**
Close the sub compaction threads in `CompactionTaskManager` after each test.

title: [To rel/0.13][IOTDB-5183]Fix CI OOM
body:
**Description**
OutOfMemory unable to create new native thread

**Reason**
The sub threads in `CompactionTaskManager` are not closed. During the test, new sub compaction thread pool is constantly created and the number of sub-threads increases, which causes OOM.

**Solution**
Close the sub compaction threads in `CompactionTaskManager` after each test.

title: [IOTDB-5168] Refactor traverse of AbstractTreeVisitor to FA-based traverse
body:
## Description

### Design
see https://apache-iotdb.feishu.cn/docx/DjrAdDM3woXcn1x5Phlcyveznqe

### Performance Test

Micro means the scale of Tree is micro, no more than 10 nodes. Massive means the scale of Tree is massive, up to 20w nodes.

Precise: precisePattern "root.db.a_0.d_0.s_0"
\*: oneLevelWildcardPattern "root.db.\*.\*.s_0"
Internal\*\*": internalMultiLevelWildcardPattern "root.\*\*.s_0"
Tail\*\*: tailMultiLevelWildcardPattern "root.\*\*"
Regex: regexPattern "root.db.a\*.d\*.s_0"

#### Before This PR
[Micro-Precise] Max: 129ms; Min: 82ms; Avg: 88ms
[Micro-\*] Max: 164ms; Min: 151ms; Avg: 154ms
[Micro-Internal\*\*] Max: 77ms; Min: 74ms; Avg: 75ms
[Micro-Tail\*\*] Max: 73ms; Min: 70ms; Avg: 71ms
[Micro-Regex] Max: 171ms; Min: 166ms; Avg: 168ms
[Massive-Precise] Max: 108ms; Min: 97ms; Avg: 100ms
[Massive-\*] Max: 166ms; Min: 161ms; Avg: 163ms
[Massive-Internal\*\*] Max: 122ms; Min: 114ms; Avg: 117ms
[Massive-Tail\*\*] Max: 113ms; Min: 106ms; Avg: 109ms
[Massive-Regex] Max: 175ms; Min: 168ms; Avg: 171ms

#### This PR
[Micro-Precise] Max: 129ms; Min: 77ms; Avg: 83ms
[Micro-\*] Max: 68ms; Min: 63ms; Avg: 65ms
[Micro-Internal\*\*] Max: 89ms; Min: 86ms; Avg: 87ms
[Micro-Tail\*\*] Max: 75ms; Min: 72ms; Avg: 72ms
[Micro-Regex] Max: 152ms; Min: 148ms; Avg: 150ms
[Massive-Precise] Max: 85ms; Min: 83ms; Avg: 84ms
[Massive-\*] Max: 90ms; Min: 86ms; Avg: 87ms
[Massive-Internal\*\*] Max: 122ms; Min: 112ms; Avg: 115ms
[Massive-Tail\*\*] Max: 108ms; Min: 102ms; Avg: 104ms
[Massive-Regex] Max: 119ms; Min: 114ms; Avg: 116ms

title: [IOTDB-5183]Fix CI OOM
body:
**Description**
OutOfMemory unable to create new native thread

**Reason**
The sub threads in `CompactionTaskManager` are not closed. During the test, new sub compaction thread pool is constantly created and the number of sub-threads increases, which causes OOM.

**Solution**
Close the sub compaction threads in `CompactionTaskManager` after each test.

## Description

title: [research/algebra] To include UDF functions for queries on different data types
body:
##Description
This is the baseline udf implementations to query time-series on various data types.
The benchmark project is github.com/thssdb/algebra for recurrence.
The baseline aims to obtain the time for loading and merging all data ahead of any filterings and optimizations.

###Content1 
Time-series queries:
(Q-S1) Selection contains 2 types: by (closed/open) time range and value, benchmarked by ClosedRange/Value and OpenRange/Value, input 1d time-series, out: 1d.
(Q-S2) Projection: ClosedRange with 2-d time-series in, 1d out.
(Q-S3) Merge: Merge 2 series with a pivot of concatenated ranges.
(Q-S4) Time equality join: ClosedRange, 2d in
(Q-S5) Aggregation by time-based sliding window: AggRWindow
(Q-A1) Sampling over time: Sample, fixed ranged window, taking 1 tuple.
(Q-A2) Generalized projection: series conversion, in: 1d time-series, conversion function f;
(Q-A3) Time equality alignment: ClosedRange query, input: nd-series 

###Content2: support operations with temporal tables
Temporal queries:
(Q-T1) Sliding window aggregation: AggCWindow, count-based sliding window,
(Q-T2) Pattern matching: PatternRWindow, in: pattern series and series to match.

###Content3: support operations with relational tables
(Q-R2) Time similarity join: SimJoin, join 2 series with tolerance.
(Q-R3) Series-temporal join: RelJoinTemporal, input: 1d series + temporal table, match corresponding events.
(Q-R4) Generalized aggregation: AggEvent, group by event and aggregation.
(Q-R5) Time similarity alignment: SimJoin, input: n-d time series.

title: [IOTDB-5158] Fix InputStream may skip over some smaller number of bytes
body:
## Description


`InputStream` may skip over some smaller number of bytes. So I implement a skip method in ReadWriteIOUtils to guarantee skip n bytes or reach end of file.

title: [To rel/1.0][IOTDB-4832] Introducing freemarker to auto-generate type-specific code
body:
During the execution of the vectorization engine, the primitive method is type-specific, so you must write separate method for each primitive data type. For example, IoTDB has six data types (except vector), so you must write six almost identical codes. These codes have the same method logic except for different type names, which brings a lot of work to the development process and code maintenance. Therefore, we can consider introducing a template based code generation framework to solve this problem.
Freemarker is a popular code generation framework. Freemarker preprocessor based on freemarker can iterate folders to generate code. With the help of some existing fmpp tools, we can easily introduce this framework. I added the drill-fmpp -maven-plugin to the pom file, which can automatically generate code during compilation and package it with other code.
I have changed some codes related to Fill. There are many redundant codes caused by type-specific method in the warehouse. I didn't change them all becuase it's a big work. After introducing this framework, we can slowly change it.

type-specific IoTDB  6vector
Freemarker  freemarker  freemarker preprocessor  fmpp  tool pom  drill-fmpp-maven-plugin 
 Fill  type-specific

title: [To rel/1.0] [IOTDB-5144] Fix ClassCastException
body: ISSUE:https://github.com/apache/iotdb/issues/8377

title: [To rel/0.13][IOTDB-5133] Export schema tool
body:
## Description

Add an export schema function to export MTree and Tag from the current system into a non-deleted mlog.bin for loading mlog in a non-empty iotdb correctly.

The schema export operation exports the information about store group, timeseries, and schema template in the current IoTDB in the form of `mlog.bin` and `tlog.txt` to the specified directory.

The exported `mlog.bin` and `tlog.txt` files can be incrementally loaded into an IoTDB instance.

### Export Schema SQL

```
EXPORT SCHEMA '<path/dir>' 
```

title: [To rel/1.0][IOTDB-5135] Sync snapshot fails when sync file is empty
body:
## Description

This problem is caused by the fact that when `ClusterSyncInfo` is empty, `SyncLogWriter` will not generate a tmpFile and `tmpFile.renameTo(snapshotFile)` will return false.

## Solution

Force the file to be initialised when taking a snapshot.

title: [IOTDB-5135] Sync snapshot fails when sync file is empty
body:
## Description

This problem is caused by the fact that when `ClusterSyncInfo` is empty, `SyncLogWriter` will not generate a tmpFile and `tmpFile.renameTo(snapshotFile)` will return false.

## Solution

Force the file to be initialised when taking a snapshot.

body:
1. Optimize the implementation of some methods
2. Specific auth relate status code
3. Add `code` in AuthException

Before:

Status | Code
-- | --
AUTHENTICATION_ERROR | 800
WRONG_LOGIN_PASSWORD | 801
NOT_LOGIN | 802
NO_PERMISSION | 803
UNINITIALIZED_AUTH_ERROR | 804
USER_NOT_EXIST | 805
ROLE_NOT_EXIST | 806
CLEAR_PERMISSION_CACHE_ERROR | 807

After

Status | Code
-- | --
INIT_AUTH_ERROR | 800
WRONG_LOGIN_PASSWORD | 801
NOT_LOGIN | 802
NO_PERMISSION | 803
USER_NOT_EXIST | 804
USER_ALREADY_EXIST | 805
USER_ALREADY_HAS_ROLE | 806
USER_NOT_HAS_ROLE | 807
ROLE_NOT_EXIST | 808
ROLE_ALREADY_EXIST | 809
ALREADY_HAS_PRIVILEGE | 810
NOT_HAS_PRIVILEGE | 811
CLEAR_PERMISSION_CACHE_ERROR | 812
UNKNOWN_AUTH_PRIVILEGE | 813
UNSUPPORTED_AUTH_OPERATION | 814
AUTH_IO_EXCEPTION | 815

title: [IOTDB-5130]Accelerate the compaction of nonOverlap points in overlap pages
body: In the fast compaction, the overlapping pages will be put into the `pointPriorityReader`, and the points are spit out in order. Every time a point is spit out, an element must be popped out from the priority queue, and then added into the queue. When the points do not overlap, it will cause a lot of invalid heap sort, which will reduce the compaction rate. For example: there are two pages, the time ranges are 1-500, 400-900, the actual overlapping part is only 400-500, and the rest of the points can be spit out directly, instead of adding into the queue and popping them out every time.

title: Make some code more efficient
body:
In this PR, 
1. Reduce the use of `Stream`.
2. Reduce the use of `String.format()`.
3. Add cached object in `DatasetHeader` to reduce repeated calculations.
4. Simplify the constructor of `FunctionExpression`.
